clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Tractography and Motor Evoked Potentials in Deep Brain Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Tractography and Motor Evoked Potentials in Deep Brain Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock: The goal is to establish another anatomical referencing system in order to achieve an even higher accuracy when implanting stimulation electrodes.

detailed_description.textblock: The main goal is to find out what are the optimal distances to these reference fiber tracts when stimulating and to find the optimal target. This has to be evaluated for each target, such as globus pallidus (Gpi), subthalamic nucleus (STN) and ventral intermediate nucleus of the thalamus (VIM) separately. This is of special importance as the investigators can demonstrate the internal capsule, which is often a generator of stimulation-induced side effects: tetanic muscle contractions, dysarthria and gaze deviations.

primary_outcome.measure: distance between stimulation electrode and motor fibers in mm
primary_outcome.description: Distances between the stimulation electrode and motor fibers as depicted on fiber tracking in millimeters in correlation to the threshold current for eliciting clinical side effects

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative intensity of stimulation in milliampere (mA)
secondary_outcome.description: Intraoperative intensity of stimulation in milliamp, which elicits an activation of contralateral muscle groups (musculus interosseus dorsalis and the musculus tibialis anterior)
Threshold of intraoperative stimulation intensity in milliamp, which elicits capsular side effects

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in disease score units on the UPDRS rating scale
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of therapeutic effects using Unified Parkinson disease rating scale (UPDRS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in disease score units on the FTRS rating scale
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of therapeutic effects using, Fahn-Tremor Rating Scale (FTRS)

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of therapeutic effects using Burke-Fahn-Marsden dystonia rating scale (BFMDRS)

study_pop.textblock: Patients who qualify for deep brain stimulation on the basis of a movement disorder and chronic pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient qualifying for deep brain stimulation on the basis of a movement disorder (Parkinson's Disease, tremor, dystonia) or chronic pain disease.
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of consent
- Electrical or other devices that preclude the performance of an MRI
